title: Trend Micro Mobile Security for Enterprise query_event_log AdminName SQL Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Trend Micro Mobile Security for Enterprise.  Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the processing of the query_event_log action. When parsing the 'user_name' field, the process does not properly validate a user-supplied string before using it to construct SQL queries. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code under the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Trend Micro has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://success.trendmicro.com/solution/1118224
timeline:
2017-05-11 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2017-09-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Steven Seeley (mr_me) of Offensive Security & Roberto Suggi Liverani - @malerisch - http://blog.malerisch.net/
